channel.title: Fixed
channel.description: Okay I Got My Quest Tab Fully Working Except One Thing.. Where It Says: 'Players Online: 3' It Halfway Works Lol... When I Login It Will Say The CURRENT Players Online.. When Some1 Logs In, It Don't Change... I Put The Codes In 'TextHandler.java' And Nowhere Else.. Where Else Do I Put It To Get It To Work? And Can You Tell Me, Where At In The File? And What Exactly Do I Put? PLEASE AND THANK YOU! Code For TextHandler.java: [code]c.sendQuest("@gre@Players Online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " ", 7332);[/code] (I Went Through 'Client.java' And Searched 'Process() {' And I Added It Under That But It Didn't Work, Gave Me Errors... Can Someone Help?)

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:21, topic:379257”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=475104.msg3474733#msg3474733 date=1295582530]

[quote author=Abandoned Dreams link=topic=475104.msg3474725#msg3474725 date=1295582349]

ITT, stupidity at it’s finest.
Go to client.java

Search for “c.sendQuest”
Remove the “c.”
[/quote]Were Past That Smart One, And Cant You Read? It Says “FIXED”
[/quote]Well, nobody even stated that error, and this topic is continuously bumped.

Plus, you’re too much of an incompetent idiot to know how to read a fucking compiler, so I don’t care whether the title says you fixed it or not, you don’t know shit.

Also, don’t be a smart ass.

You
Just
Got
Owned
By
Thomas

LAWL.[/quote]

sorry for bringing this up again… but…

owned.jpg640×512

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Abandoned Dreams, post:9, topic:379257”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=475104.msg3474301#msg3474301 date=1295559237]
Read your error… it says that texthandler can’t understand what the variable “c” means.

P.S: Capitalizing every word is lack of grammar and doesn’t make your writing neater. First of all, this is computer writing. It is already neat. There is no way you can make it look neater by lacking your grammar.
[/quote]Your A True Dumbass Arn’t You…? Says, CLIENT.JAVA Can’t Read It Smart One… I Added It Under ‘Process() {’ And You Asked For Error… There It Is…

P.S: I Don’t Care What You Think… I Think It Looks Neater Because Capitals Are Better.[/quote]

Don’t be a dick when he gave you the right answer.

And if you put it under process() { it should work because process is called (updated) every 500 miliseconds.

Read full topic

The c. stands for that the code needs to work in client.java, But if you use c. in your client.java it dont work because its already in it! so delete c.
[/quote][/quote]Yea, I Did That, But It Won’t Update.

item.title: Fixed
item.dc:creator: @Abandoned_Dreams Abandoned Dreams
item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

Okay I Got My Quest Tab Fully Working Except One Thing… Where It Says:
‘Players Online: 3’
It Halfway Works Lol… When I Login It Will Say The CURRENT Players Online… When Some1 Logs In, It Don’t Change…
I Put The Codes In ‘TextHandler.java’ And Nowhere Else… Where Else Do I Put It To Get It To Work? And Can You Tell Me, Where At In The File? And What Exactly Do I Put? PLEASE AND THANK YOU!
Code For TextHandler.java:

c.sendQuest("@gre@Players Online: " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " ", 7332);

(I Went Through ‘Client.java’ And Searched ‘Process() {’ And I Added It Under That But It Didn’t Work, Gave Me Errors… Can Someone Help?)

Read full topic
